alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 10:14AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City UT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Weber River...including Huntsville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet, low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Monday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage, or about 1000 CFS, Tuesday through Thursday with a maximum value of 5.3 feet, or about 1500 CFS, Friday morning. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet, or 992 CFS. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
